topics.title: Introduction to JSON
topics.content: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation. It is a lightweight data format used for storing and transporting data.

topics.title: JSON Syntax
JSON Data Types
topics.content:
JSON supports:

• String
• Number
• Boolean
• Array
• Object
• null

topics.title: JSON Object
topics.content: Objects are enclosed in curly braces {} and contain key-value pairs.

topics.title: JSON Array
topics.content: Arrays are enclosed in square brackets [] and can contain multiple values.

topics.title: JSON.parse()
topics.content: JSON.parse() converts JSON string into JavaScript object.

topics.title: JSON.stringify()
topics.content: JSON.stringify() converts JavaScript object into JSON string.
